name: Fruit for Kids! Trivia Game | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: This is a long yellow fruit. Monkeys love to eat them!
questions.explanation:
banana.

	The hard outer case of a banana peels back to reveal a wonderful inside, soft and delicious!

questions.text: This is a red, delicious fruit. One a day will keep the doctor away!
questions.explanation:
apple.

	Sometimes apples are yellow or green too.  There are many types of apples!

questions.text: Some people call this red fruit a vegetable, but it's really a fruit...and very juicy!
questions.explanation:
tomato.

	You can tell that tomatoes are fruits because they have seeds in them.  Cucumbers and peppers are also fruits.

questions.text: Which of these fruits is not considered a citrus fruit?
questions.explanation:
cranberry.

	Citrus fruits like lemons, limes and oranges have a lot of Vitamin C, so eat them (or drink their juice) all the time!

questions.text: This fruit comes in bunches, and is most commonly red, purple or green.
questions.explanation:
grape.

	Grapes are used to make grape juice, and wine for adults.  My favorite use for grapes is to just eat them, one by one.

coconut.

	Coconut milk is not really milk, but just the juice (or nectar) of the fruit.  Real milk comes from animals like cows.

questions.text: This tropical fruit is grown in Hawaii. The most famous brand name is 'Dole'.
questions.explanation:
pineapple.

	Pineapples have a very rough outside, but a moist and sweet yellow fruit on the inside...delicious!

questions.text: Which of the following is not a melon?
questions.explanation:
gourd.

	A gourd is more like a squash than a melon.  Melons are always hard on the outside but sweet on the inside.

questions.text: What is a dried grape called?
questions.explanation:
raisin (sultana).

	Can you tell I like grapes?  Raisins - which are called "sultanas" in some countries - can be brown, yellow or even green!

questions.text: Which of the following is not a color of berry?
questions.explanation:
Purple, with pink polka-dots.

	If you ever see a berry that has pink polka-dots, you probably better not eat it.  Blackberries, Blueberries and Raspberries all grow on bushes.  I hope you enjoyed this quiz and thank you for playing!
